intro: Dialytheca gossweileri, commonly known as the Cape mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has small, alternate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations. Dialytheca gossweileri is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
